name: Diana Princess of Wales Memorial Walk

ai.summary: The Diana Princess of Wales Memorial Walk is a long urban memorial route through central London, honoring Diana, Princess of Wales. The route is described here as 21.9 km, combining parkland paths with city streets and offering a mix of green spaces and iconic London sights. While scenic, its length makes it a challenging day-long hike, suitable for experienced walkers and those comfortable with urban terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily paved sidewalks and park paths with occasional uneven surfaces, gentle gradients in park areas, and some stairs. Expect busy pedestrian areas, road crossings, and segments along busy streets with potential crowds and cyclists.
ai.safety_notes: Treat it as an urban hike: stay on designated pedestrian paths, use crossings, and be mindful of traffic and cyclists. Dress for UK weather, stay hydrated, and carry a charged phone with emergency contacts. Pace yourself for the long distance, take regular breaks, and consider coordinating with public transport for start or finish if needed.
recommended_gear: Map, guide app, or offline navigation
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn offer the best conditions with longer daylight and milder weather; winter is possible with proper layering and rain protection, but daylight and conditions may be challenging.

seo.title: Diana Princess of Wales Memorial Walk - 21.9 km Urban Hike in London, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Diana Princess of Wales Memorial Walk in London. A long 21.9 km urban hike along parks and historic streets, with safety tips, gear recommendations, and the best seasons to go.
